conclusion: To determine the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the current-carrying wire, we need to consider the contributions from each segment of the wire separately and then sum them up.
Segment ac with length L and segment cd with length 2L.
The magnetic field B is perpendicular to the plane of the wire and directed into the page.

premise: The current I flows along segment ac. The length vector L_ac for segment ac is L j (assuming a to c is along the y-axis). The magnetic field B is B k (into the page).
conclusion: The force on segment ac is F_ac = I (L j x B k) = I L B i.

premise: The magnitude of the force on segment ac is I L B.
The current I flows along segment cd. The length vector L_cd for segment cd is 2L i (assuming c to d is along the x-axis). The magnetic field B is B k (into the page).
conclusion: The force on segment cd is F_cd = I (2L i x B k) = -2I L B j.

premise: The magnitude of the force on segment cd is 2I L B.
The total force F is the vector sum of F_ac and F_cd: F = I L B i - 2I L B j.
